intro: Pandiaka carsonii var. carsonii, commonly known as Carson's pandiaka, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
